message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The picture shows "cherry-red" spot at the center of macula, which is a characteristic finding in Tay-Sachs disease. Tay-Sachs disease is caused by an accumulation of GM2 ganglioside due to a deficiency of hexosaminidase A enzyme. Therefore, a blood test for hexosaminidase A is the next best assay to evaluate this patient's health.

Tay-Sachs disease is a lysosomal storage disease caused by a deficiency of hexosaminidase A, so a blood test for hexosaminidase is the next best assay to evaluate the patient's health.
